items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ Randa Barsoum, Tax Partner at PwC US, highlights that energy incentives are only part of the tax picture for sustainability. She emphasizes less obvious supportsâ€”state and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation like reimagining packaging or processesâ€”and urges viewing sustainability investments through a broader tax lens to unlock value.
bullets: Energy incentives are familiar but not comprehensive.
State and local abatements can materially support sustainability projects.
Location-based incentives affect siting and investment choices.
R&D tax credits can apply when sustainability involves innovation (e.g., packaging or process redesign).
Viewing sustainability investments broadly can unlock meaningful tax value.
takeaways: Look beyond federal energy creditsâ€”investigate state and local abatements to lower project and operating costs.
Include location-based incentives in site-selection and expansion analyses to capture additional tax benefits.
Assess R&D tax credit eligibility when sustainability projects involve innovation or process redesigns.
Frame sustainability investments as potential tax-advantaged initiatives to strengthen project economics and decision-making.

items.title: Why data is critical to sustainable supply chains

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ David Linich, Sustainability Principal at PwC US, explains that reliable, high-quality data enables organizations to scenario plan, protect margins, and deliver sustainable, high-quality products at the right place and time. With conditions changing week by week, he emphasizes that data-driven decision-making is critical to building resilient, modern supply chains.
bullets: Global supply chains face constant disruption, from shifting tariffs to margin pressure.
Reliable, high-quality data enables scenario planning.
Data helps organizations protect margins.
Data supports delivery of sustainable, high-quality products at the right place and time.
Weekly changes in conditions make data-driven decisions essential for resilient supply chains.
takeaways: Prioritize reliable, high-quality supply chain data to enable effective scenario planning for operational resilience.
Use data-driven insights to protect margins and maintain service consistency amid frequent changes.
Embed sustainability metrics in supply chain data to ensure delivery of sustainable, high-quality products.
Develop processes that leverage up-to-date data for rapid decision-making and resilience building.

items.title: Build your first GraphRAG Powered Agent! (No Graph Expert Required) | Databases for AI

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ Knowledge locked in docs, PDFs, and wikis can be unlocked with knowledge graphs so AI models can reason over that content. The session demonstrates, via live demo and real documents, how to build a GraphRAG-powered knowledge graph in an afternoon using the same AI tools teams already use, and includes a sample notebook.
bullets: Problem: critical knowledge is trapped in unstructured docs, PDFs, and wikis.
Knowledge graphs enable models to reason over that content.
Most teams avoid building graphs because it seems like a big effort.
This session shows a hands-on demo to build a GraphRAG agent in an afternoon using familiar AI tools.
Sample code/notebook is provided to reproduce the workflow.
takeaways: Faster access to institutional knowledge can improve AI-driven decision support for grid and data center operations.
A knowledge-graph approach can be implemented quickly (an afternoon) rather than as a long, costly project.
Teams can leverage existing AI toolchains without needing deep graph expertise to start extracting value.
Provided sample code and live demo shorten the path from pilot to practical usage in operational contexts.

items.title: Cloud Cost Efficiency I The Keys to AWS Optimization | S16 E2

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦This livestream examines key AWS cost-efficiency metrics such as cost per transaction, resource utilization rates, and ROI, and explains how to measure, track, and optimize cloud spending. It also demonstrates practical benchmarking approaches and dashboard-building to align technical performance with business outcomes for cloud engineers, FinOps teams, and technical leaders.
bullets: Focus on essential KPIs: cost per transaction, utilization rates, and ROI calculations.
Guidance on measuring, tracking, and optimizing AWS spending with metrics frameworks.
Practical approaches to benchmarking cloud efficiency and spotting optimization opportunities.
How to build dashboards that communicate cost/benefit to stakeholders.
Target audience: cloud engineers, FinOps teams, and technical leaders.
takeaways: Prioritize measurable KPIs (cost per transaction, utilization) to quantify cloud efficiency and guide investments.
Use benchmarking to surface where infrastructure or operations can be right-sized or rearchitected for savings.
Build stakeholder-facing dashboards to translate technical metrics into business value and justify optimization work.
Calculate and present ROI to make a business case for cost-optimization efforts across the organization.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy is a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California who brings in $251K a year by working three jobs and running a personal finance brand called Financially Intentional. She carried nearly $1 million in debt in 2015, documented her debt-payoff journey, and was debt-free by 2017.
bullets: Naseema McElroy is a labor and delivery nurse and founder of Financially Intentional.
She earns $251K annually through three jobs in the Bay Area.
Accumulated nearly $1 million in debt in 2015.
Documented her debt payoff publicly and became debt-free by 2017.
Profile is part of CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
takeaways: Bay Area workers may combine multiple income streams and entrepreneurial activitiesâ€”consider how staffing and benefits offerings can accommodate nontraditional work arrangements.
Personal finance creators rely on a digital presence, suggesting demand for reliable, scalable hosting and content-delivery services.
Stories of rapid debt payoff and income diversification highlight the importance of accessible fintech and online financial-education platforms that depend on resilient infrastructure.
